lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/idkname.IDKName.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run idkname.IDKName.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

A greenfield Java project template named after the Java mascot **Duke**.
This project was bootstrapped to provide a clean starting point for building Java applications with proper structure, tests, and style guidelines.
1. Open IntelliJ (if you have a project open, click **File > Close Project** first).
- Click **OK** and accept defaults for any further prompts.
If setup is correct, you can move on to the chatbot!
- IDKName Chatbot is a JavaFX desktop app for managing tasks with simple commands.
- It features a retro game-inspired interface and a task manager backend.
- Users type commands in the input box, and the bot replies in the main chat area with feedback, errors, or the task list.
Shows all tasks currently in your task list, along with their type and completion status.
Exits the chatbot gracefully and saves all tasks to file.
Marks the task with the given ID as completed.
Unmarks the task with the given ID (sets it back to not done).
Searches the task list for tasks containing the keyword in their description.
Creates a simple todo task with the given description.
Creates a deadline task with the given description and a due date.
Creates an event task scheduled between a start and end date/time
If you need any help for the instructions!
This project uses **Gradle** as its build tool.
* Main entry point for the IDKName task management application.
* This class coordinates between the user interface ({@link Command}),
* the task list ({@link TaskList}), and the storage system ({@link Storage}).
* It handles initialization, running the user interaction loop,
* and saving/loading tasks from persistent storage.
* Constructs a new instance of the IDKName application.
* Initializes the task list, UI, and storage, and attempts
* to load tasks from the given file path.
* @param filePath the path to the storage file for saving and loading tasks
assert filePath != null : "filePath must not be null";
* Returns the initial greeting message shown to the user when the application starts.
* Returns the farewell message shown to the user when the application exits.
* Persists the current state of the application before exit.
* @throws IOException if an error occurs while saving data to storage
* Generates a response for the given user input.
* @param input the raw user input string
* @return the application's response to the input
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* Entry point for the IDKName chatbot application.
* This class initializes the chatbot with a storage file path
private final IdKName chatbot = new IdKName(DEFAULT_FILE_PATH);
* if available, and begins interacting with the user.
assert stage != null : "Stage must not be null";
assert ap != null : "Root AnchorPane should be loaded";
assert controller != null : "MainWindow controller not injected by FXML";
: "Hello! I'm IdKName\nWhat can I do for you?"
// add: on close, append goodbye and persist safely
: "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!"
* Represents a task with a description and a due date.
* Constructs a Deadline with the given description and due date.
* @param message the description of the deadline task
* @param date    the due date of the deadline
* Returns due date of task, to save later
* If position is unset, null is returned.
* Returns task type of task, to save later
* Returns string representation of Deadline Task.
* @return String output of a Deadline Task.
* Compares this deadline with the specified object for equality.
* Two deadlines are considered equal if they have the same description,
* the same completion status, and the same due date.
* @param o the object to compare with
* @return true if this deadline is equal to the specified object; false otherwise
* Compares deadlines by due date; other tasks by type rank.
* Represents a task that occurs over a time period,
* defined by a start and end datetime.
* Constructs an Event with the given description, start, and end times.
* @param message the description of the event
* @param start   the start datetime of the event
* @param end     the end datetime of the event
public Event(String message, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end) {
* Returns time period of task, to save later
* If position is unset, null is returned.
* @return an array of LocalDateTime to be accessed when saving
* Returns task type of task, to save later
* Returns string representation of Event Task.
* Eg output. [D][] homework (from: Oct 3 2018 1200 to: Oct 3 2018 1400)
* @return String output of an Event Task.
return String.format("(E)%s (from: %s to: %s)", super.toString(), startDate, endDate);
* Compares this event with the specified object for equality.
* Two events are considered equal if they have the same description,
* the same completion status, and the same start and end dates.
* @param o the object to compare with
* @return true if this event is equal to the specified object; false otherwise
* Compares events by start time; other tasks by type rank.
* Represents an abstract task with a description and completion status.
* Subclasses (Todo, Deadline, Event) provide additional fields and behavior.
public abstract class Task implements Comparable<Task> {
private static final Map<String, Integer> ORDER_OF_TYPES =
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* By default, tasks are not marked as done.
* @param description the description of the task
assert description != null : "Task description must not be null";
* Returns the type of this task as a single-letter code.
* For example: "T" for Todo, "D" for Deadline, "E" for Event.
* @return the type code of the task
* Returns the due date of this task if it is a Deadline.
* @return the due date, or null if not applicable
* Returns the time period of this task if it is an Event.
* @return an array of LocalDateTime [start, end], or null if not applicable
* Returns whether this task is marked as done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Returns the description of the task
* Returns "X" if the task is done, or a space if not.
return (isDone ? "DONE" : "NOTDONE"); // mark done task with X
* Marks Task done and prints message if called by the user (load is false)
*  Marks Task done and not print message if not called by the user (load is true)
*  Prints different message if task already marked as done
* @param gettingLoaded the boolean to check if loaded
return String.format("Task already marked as done: %n%s", this);
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done: %n%s", this);
* Marks Task undone and prints message
* Prints different message if task already marked as done
return String.format("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: %n%s", this);
return String.format("Task already marked as not done: %n%s", this);
* Returns a String representation of task description and mark/unmark sign
assert description != null : "Task must always have a description";
* Compares this task with the specified object for equality.
* Two tasks are considered equal if they have the same description,
* @param o the object to compare with
* @return true if this task is equal to the specified object; false otherwise
* Compares tasks by type rank (T < D < E).
* Represents a simple task without a due date or time period.
* Constructs a Todo with the given description.
* @param message the description of the todo
* Returns string representation of Todo Task.
* @return String output of a Todo Task.
* Returns task type of task, to save

public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {

public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {

assert d != null : "Injected Duke instance must not be null";

* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
assert duke != null : "Duke instance not set; call setDuke() before use";

* to the dialog container in the UI.

assert duke != null : "Duke instance not set; call setDuke() before use";
* Handles all user interactions with the application, including
* greetings, goodbye messages, error messages, and command input.
* Creates a new {@code Command} facade bound to a bot name and task list.
* @param name  bot/display name used in greetings
* @param tasks the task list this command handler operates on
* Returns the message shown when no save file is found during load.
* @return user-facing error message for missing save file
* Returns the message shown when a supplied date/time cannot be parsed.
* @return user-facing error message describing valid date/time formats
return String.format("Invalid date format.Please enter as:"
* Returns the message shown when task data cannot be persisted to disk.
* Returns the message shown when a task index is outside the valid range.
* @return user-facing error message for an invalid task number
return "Task not found. Please enter a valid task number.";
* Returns the message shown when a numeric argument is malformed
* (e.g., a non-integer where a task index is expected).
* @return user-facing hint on the expected command + task number format
return String.format("Please enter a valid command:"
* Builds a numbered, line-separated view of the provided tasks.
* @return formatted list, one task per line with 1-based indexing
* Returns the greeting shown at application start.
* @return greeting message including the bot name
+ "%nWhat can I do for you?", this.name);
* Returns the farewell shown when the program exits.
return "Bye. Hope to see you again!";
* Returns the message shown when the command word is not recognized.
* @return user-facing error message for unknown commands and a brief hint
return String.format("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-("
+ "%n(Eg. todo, deadline, event, find, mark, unmark, list, bye)%n");
* Returns the message shown when a command is missing required arguments.
* Provides usage examples for valid commands.
* @return user-facing error message plus example usages
return String.format("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-("
+ "%nPlease enter a valid command and a valid instruction%n%s", this.showHelp());
return String.format("Try any of these valid instructions!"
* Main loop for handling user input.
* Reads commands from the user, parses them, and executes the corresponding actions.
* Handles invalid commands and errors gracefully by showing appropriate error messages.
assert parts.length > 0 : "Parser should never return blank string";
assert !parts[0].isBlank() : "Command word must not be blank";
out.append("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n");
* Utility class that handles parsing of user input strings into
* structured values such as task descriptions, IDs, and dates/times.
* Splits a line of user input into at most two parts:
* the first word (usually the command) and the rest of the line.
* @return a string array of length 1 (if only command given)
assert input != null : "input must not be null";
* Converts a user-specified task number into a zero-based index.
* @param taskNumber the task number as a string (1-based index)
* @throws NumberFormatException if the task number is not a valid integer
assert taskNumber != null : "taskNumber must not be null";
throw new NumberFormatException("Task id must be >= 1");
* Parses a deadline description of the form
*         or null if the input is invalid
assert description != null : "description must not be null";
* Parses an event description of the form
* @return an array of length 3: [description, startString, endString],
*         or null if the input is invalid
assert description != null : "description must not be null";
return new String[] { desc, start, end };
* Parses a date string in ISO-8601 format (yyyy-MM-dd) into a {@link LocalDate}.
* @param date the date string to parse
* @throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException if the string is not in the correct format
assert date != null : "date string must not be null";
* Parses a datetime string in ISO-8601 format (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm[:ss]) into a {@link LocalDateTime}.
* @param date the datetime string to parse
* @throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException if the string is not in the correct format
assert date != null : "date string must not be null";
* Handles reading from and writing to a persistent storage file
* that contains the user's task list.
* Tasks are stored in plain text format, with fields separated by "|".
* Supported task types: Todo (T), Deadline (D), Event (E).
* Constructs a Storage object responsible for persisting a given task list.
* @param tasks    the task list to read from or write to
* @param filePath the path to the storage file
* Saves the current tasks to the storage file.
* Creates parent directories if they do not exist.
* Tasks are serialized in the following formats:
* @throws IOException if an error occurs during writing
* Loads tasks from the storage file into the associated task list.
* Expected line formats are the same as in {@link #save()}.
* @throws FileNotFoundException if the storage file does not exist
* Provides operations to add, delete, retrieve, and update tasks.
* Adds a task to the list given its type and description.
* @param type the type of task to add ("todo", "deadline", or "event")
* @param item the task description and additional data (e.g., date/time)
* @throws DateTimeException if the input format for a date/time is invalid
public String add(String type, String item) {
assert (type != null) && (item != null) : "Index out of bounds";
t = new Todo(item); // add description normally
return String.format("Got it. I've added this task:"
+ "%nNow you have %d tasks in the list.%n",
t, this.tasks.size()); // t will never be null as we check if type and item exist
* Adds a task directly to the list.
* Deletes a task from the list given its task number (1-based).
* @param taskNumber the 1-based task number as a string
* @throws NumberFormatException if the task number is not a valid integer
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the task number does not exist in the list
int taskId = Parser.getTaskId(taskNumber); // may throw NumberFormatException
assert taskId >= 0 && taskId < this.tasks.size() : "Index out of bounds";
return String.format("Noted. I've removed this task: %n%s%n Now you have %d tasks in the list.%n",
* Retrieves a task by its zero-based index.
* @param taskNumber the zero-based index of the task
* @return the task at the specified index
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
assert taskNumber >= 0 && taskNumber < this.tasks.size() : "Index out of bounds";
* Returns the underlying list of tasks.
* Marks a task as done or undone, given its task number (1-based).
* @param b           true to mark as done, false to mark as undone
* @param taskNumber  the 1-based task number as a string
* @throws NumberFormatException if the task number is not a valid integer
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the task number does not exist in the list
public String markDoneOrUndone(boolean b, String taskNumber) {
int taskId = Parser.getTaskId(taskNumber); // may throw NumberFormatException
assert taskId >= 0 && taskId < this.tasks.size() : "Index out of bounds";
* Searches the list for similar descriptions

* Returns tasks of the given type (todo, deadline, event) in sorted order.
* @param description task type to filter by
* Returns an iterator over the tasks in the list.
